raw_mentions:
Here are the extracted sentences that meet the criteria:

Briefly, radiolabeled GFs bound intact FN with the following KDs as judged by non linear regression: TGF-β1, KD=5.3×10<sup>−8 </sup>M; PDGF-BB, KD=4.9×10<sup>−</sup>M, FGF-2, KD=4.4×10<sup>−8 </sup>M.
As determined by plasmon resonance modulation, all GFs, except EGF, bound to the composite heparinII-binding and variably-spliced IIICS domains (FNIII<sub>12-V15</sub>) with the following order of affinities: VEGF (KD=6.0×10<sup>−10 </sup>M)>TGF-β1 (KD=2.5×10<sup>−9 </sup>M)>PDGF-BB (KD=1.7×10<sup>−8 </sup>M)>FGF-2 (KD=3.7×10<sup>−8 </sup>M).
Similar rank orders of affinities were observed with GF binding to the heparinII-binding domain (FNIII<sub>12-15 </sub>and FNIII<sub>12-14</sub>): PDGF-BB (KD=6.8×10<sup>−8 </sup>M)≧TGF-β1 (KD=1.6×10<sup>−8 </sup>M)>FGF-2 (KD=1.7×10<sup>−7 </sup>M); TGF-β1 (KD=7.6×10<sup>−9 </sup>M)>PDGF-BB (KD=5.5×10<sup>−8 </sup>M), respectively.
VEGF, TGF-β1, PDGF-BB and FGF-2 bound IIICS with similar affinities (KD=10<sup>−7 </sup>M).
Our equilibrium binding experiments indicate binding affinities of 1.3×10<sup>−7 </sup>M, 2.7×10<sup>−7 </sup>M, 1.4×10<sup>−7 </sup>M and 1×10<sup>−7 </sup>M, respectively.
Peptide 1 also binds PDGF-BB (KD=2.5×10<sup>−7 </sup>M) while a scrambled control does not.
Further analysis of peptide 1 demonstrated that QPSHISKYILRWRPK (peptide 1A; SEQ ID NO:______) and ILRWRPKNSVGRWK (peptide 1B; SEQ ID NO:______) bound TGF-β1 with affinities of 4.4×10<sup>−7 </sup>M and 4.0×10<sup>−7 </sup>M, respectively, while QPSHISKY (SEQ ID NO:______) had minimal binding activity.
